title: Watch John Legend Bring 'La La Land' to Life at 2017 Oscars - Rolling Stone
text:
'The Walking Dead' Recap: Revenge of the Nerd Watch John Legend Bring 'La La Land' to Life at 2017 Oscars Singer, who appeared in and executive produced Best Picture nominee, performed "City of Stars," "Audition (The Fools Who Dream)" John Legend performed two Oscar-nominated songs from 'La La Land' at the 2017 ceremony. Watch John Legend Bring 'La La Land' to Life at 2017 Oscars All Stories 
John Legend gave a soulful performance of two Best Song nominees from La La Land . at the 2017 Oscars, "City of Stars" and "Audition (The Fools Who Dream)." Legend executive produced and appeared in La La Land , while Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone respectively, sang the versions that appear in the film. Related 2017 Oscars: The Complete Winners List Our full list of everyone who's bringing home the gold at tonight's Academy Awards 
Legend performed on a shifting stage modeled after scenes from the film including vivid backdrops of the Los Angeles night sky. The singer performed unaccompanied behind a grand piano, as backup dancers waltzed, spun around street lamps and even levitated. Immediately following the production, "City of Stars" co-writers Benj Pasek and Justin Paul won the Best Original Song award. 
La La Land was nominated in 14 categories at this year's ceremony, including Best Actor and Best Actress nominations for Gosling and Stone. Legend is not nominated this year, but won for Best Original Song alongside Common in 2015 for their track "Glory" off the Selma soundtrack. La La Land is Legend's second major film role, having had a minor part in the 2008 musical comedy Soul Men starring Bernie Mac and Samuel L.
